item.title: Listen to a conversation about Pixel Watch 4’s new hardware, inside and out.

review.headline_rewrite: Listen to a conversation about Pixel Watch 4’s new hardware, inside and out.
bullets: In the latest Made by Google podcast episode, host Rachid Finge dives deep into our newest wearable, Pixel Watch 4, with product lead Francis Hoe.

Rachid and Francis walk through the watch’s many firsts, including:
- A domed Actua 360 display that’s bigger than ever before (all the better to see Material 3 Expressive!)
- A longer-lasting, faster-charging battery with a new side-charging system
- A serviceable design with a replaceable battery and display
- Standalone emergency satellite communications
- Improved health and fitness tracking
- Raise to Talk with Gemini, right from your wrist
- Accessory bands in a bunch of new colors and materials
The end result is a completely redesigned watch inside and out, as Francis explains: “It's something that's really personal to you in how it looks, how it feels and what it does.”
Listen to the full conversation on Apple Podcasts or Spotify, or watch below.

item.title: AI On: 6 Ways AI Agents Are Raising Team Performance — and How to Measure It

review.headline_rewrite: AI On: 6 Ways AI Agents Are Raising Team Performance — and How to Measure It
bullets: Editor’s note: This post is part of the AI On blog series, which explores the latest techniques and real-world applications of agentic AI, chatbots and copilots.

The series also highlights the NVIDIA software and hardware powering advanced AI agents, which form the foundation of AI query engines that gather insights and perform tasks to transform everyday experiences and reshape industries.
AI agents are expected to be involved in most business tasks within three years, with effective human-agent collaboration projected to increase human engagement in high-value tasks by 65%.
AI agents can help achieve and exceed efficiency goals as they learn, reason and adjust based on context and outcomes.
Here are six ways agentic AI boosts team performance — and practical tips for measuring its impact.

Accelerating Software Development With AI Agents
AI agents can act as intelligent copilots, helping automate code generation, testing and deployment.

item.title: Veo 3 comes to Google Photos. Try it in the new Create tab.

review.headline_rewrite: Veo 3 comes to Google Photos. Try it in the new Create tab.
bullets: You can find this powerful new tool, along with other generative AI features, in our new Create tab.
Now available in the U.S., the Create tab is your central hub for creativity in Google Photos.
Google Photos users get a limited number of generations each day, with more generations for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers.
Google Photos users get a limited number of generations each day, with more generations for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers.

item.title: Microsoft is about to shake up its Copilot pricing for businesses

review.headline_rewrite: Microsoft is about to shake up its Copilot pricing for businesses
bullets: It’s no secret that Microsoft has been struggling to sell its Copilot AI assistant to businesses.
The steep pricing has put many businesses off paying extra for Microsoft’s AI services, especially when OpenAI’s ChatGPT has been gaining traction in the all-important enterprise market.

Sources familiar with Microsoft’s AI plans tell me that the company is about to ax this standalone $20 add-on and bundle Copilot for Sales, Service, and Finance into the main Microsoft 365 Copilot subscription.

This move will take the price of most of Microsoft’s top AI tools down to $30 per user per month, instead of the $50 per user per month businesses have to pay for Microsoft 365 Copilot and Copilot for Sales, Service, and Finance together — essentially giving away the add-on.
This monetization strategy change is part of a broader AI shakeup across the Microsoft 365 Copilot team and the Business and Industry Copilot (BIC) teams.

This week, Lamanna announced internally that Microsoft’s Copilot, Agents, and Platform Ecosystem (CAPE) team is also joining BIC, as part of an effort to “bring more business value into the broader M365 agent platform.”
Microsoft is increasingly stepping up its focus on AI agents, much like the rest of the tech industry.

item.title: Threads challenges X by offering free support for up to 10K characters, plus prominent links

review.headline_rewrite: Threads challenges X by offering free support for up to 10K characters, plus prominent links
bullets: However, X in 2023 introduced a way for its paid subscribers to post up to 25,000 characters, in the hopes of encouraging creators to publish their content directly on its platform.
Seeing this trend, X tried to capitalize on the demand for a longer character count by making it a paid feature.
Threads, however, is making its additional characters available for free.

item.title: Google Photos upgrades its image-to-video feature with Veo 3

review.headline_rewrite: Google Photos upgrades its image-to-video feature with Veo 3
bullets: The new model, available on the mobile app’s Create tab, will allow users in the U.S.

The launch also represents how the company is working to bring its latest AI tech to consumers through its products — Google Photos, for instance, had over 1.5 billion monthly active users as of May 2025.

Introduced in May at its I/O developer conference, Google brought Veo 3, which added image-to-video generation, to its Gemini app in July, making it available on its AI Ultra and AI Pro subscription plans.
On those plans, users could generate three videos per day, which would carry both visible and invisible watermarks to identify the videos as being AI generated.
With Veo 3, the feature will remain free with a limited number of generations available, says Google.
AI Pro and AI Ultra subscribers will have access to more generations.
